misdeed: A strange illness has befallen the livestock of a small village nestled near a sprawling forest.  Animals are found trembling, their fur falling out, and their bodies covered in strange welts. Whispers of a vengeful spirit haunting the woods spread fear among the villagers.
solution: The Vaesen is an Ash Tree Wife and can be destroyed by burning or cutting down the ash tree it inhabits.

clues.description: The sick animals refuse to drink from a specific stream that flows down from the nearby forest.
A local herbalist discovers traces of an unknown plant toxin in the animals' feed, one that smells faintly of decaying wood and wildflowers.
The woodsmen speak of an ancient, imposing ash tree deep within the forest, a place they avoid out of superstition.
A young girl claims to have seen a beautiful woman with skin like bark weeping beneath the ash tree, surrounded by sick animals.
The ground around the ash tree is littered with animal bones, and the air hangs heavy with the scent of decay and fear.
The villagers discover an old offering bowl hidden among the roots of the ash tree, containing a lock of golden hair and a withered flower.

plotTwist.description: A young shepherd, distraught over the loss of his favorite sheepdog, unknowingly made a pact with the Vaesen, offering his own blood in exchange for the animal's return.
